skill.name: create-issue
skill.description: Create an issue in GitHub or Jira. Automatically detects if GitHub issues are enabled; if so creates a GitHub issue, otherwise creates a Jira issue.
skill.summary: Create an issue in GitHub or Jira. Automatically detects if GitHub issues are enabled; if so creates...
skill.author: Cloud-Officer

security_audit.summary: Prompt-based skill that uses standard CLI tools (gh, jira) to create issues. No executable code - only instructions. Capabilities match stated purpose. Uses temp file that is cleaned up after use.

content.user_title: Create GitHub or Jira issues automatically
content.value_statement: Manually creating issues takes time away from development. This skill detects your issue tracker and creates properly formatted issues with templates for bugs, tasks, and stories.
actual_capabilities: Detects if GitHub issues are enabled in the repository
Creates GitHub issues using the gh CLI tool
Creates Jira issues using the jira CLI tool
Maps severity levels to Jira priorities
Cleans up temporary files after issue creation
limitations: Requires gh CLI installed and authenticated for GitHub issues
Requires jira CLI installed and configured for Jira issues
Cannot create issues without proper CLI authentication

use_cases.title: Quick bug reports
use_cases.description: Create detailed bug reports with reproduction steps, environment details, and severity assessments.

use_cases.title: Feature stories
use_cases.description: Write user stories with business value, acceptance criteria, and cross-team requirements.

use_cases.title: Task tracking
use_cases.description: Create tasks with scope definitions, security considerations, and testing strategies.

prompt_templates.title: Report a bug
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a bug report for [brief description]. The issue happens in [environment] when [steps to reproduce]. Expected: [what should happen]. Actual: [what actually happened]. Severity: [Critical|Major|Minor].

prompt_templates.title: New feature request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a story for [feature name]. User group: [who benefits]. Goal: [what to achieve]. Business value: [why this matters]. Include design links and API requirements.

prompt_templates.title: Technical task
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a task for [task name]. Scope: [what is included]. Out of scope: [what is excluded]. Technical details: [any code or implementation notes]. Security impact: [Yes/No].

prompt_templates.title: Quick issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an issue titled [title] with body: [description]. Type: [Task|Bug|Story]. Priority: [severity]. Assignee: [username if specified].

output_examples.input: Create a bug report for login failure. Users cannot log in on production. Expected: Users authenticate successfully. Actual: Error 500 after password entry. Severity: Critical.
output: Title: Bug - Login failure on production
Body includes: Environment details, reproduction steps, severity assessment

best_practices: Provide as much detail as possible in your request to generate comprehensive issues
Specify the issue type (Bug, Task, or Story) to use the appropriate template
Include severity/priority to ensure proper triaging of the issue
anti_patterns: Creating issues without specifying the type or severity
Leaving placeholder text like [Insert link] in the generated issue
Using for issues on unsupported platforms without gh or jira CLI installed

faq.question: What issue trackers are supported?
faq.answer: GitHub Issues and Jira. The skill automatically detects which tracker is available based on repository configuration.

faq.question: What information is required to create an issue?
faq.answer: At minimum, a title and description. Optional: issue type, severity, assignee username, and any specific labels.

faq.question: How does the skill handle authentication?
faq.answer: Authentication is handled by the gh and jira CLI tools. Ensure you are logged in to these tools before using the skill.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only writes to a temporary file that is immediately deleted after issue creation. No data is stored or sent to third parties.

faq.question: What if the issue creation hangs?
faq.answer: The skill uses a 15-second timeout for Jira commands. If it hangs, check your jira CLI configuration and ensure all required fields are provided.

faq.question: How is this different from creating issues manually?
faq.answer: The skill uses templates to ensure consistent, comprehensive issue documentation. It also automatically handles tracker detection and priority mapping.
